page.title: 03SETTLEMENT CHANGES cont.
page.content:
1795 The largest settlement still is Goring, with W. Ferring and Durrington in particular being contrastingly small. Northbrook farm and Ecclesdon farm were mapped. There were three woods, one of which stretches across where today there is a road.
1813 The village of Hangleton had by now become large enough to map, emerging alongside the main road. The development of Ferring was of note which had now split into east and west. Some woods had been cleared near Highdown and a few settlements had emerged.
